page.title: 16UPHILL COASTAL DEFENCES
page.content: THE BRISTOL CHANNEL ACTS AS A FUNNEL ESPECIALLY FOR WESTERLY AND NORTH WESTERLY WINDS.WHEN SUCH GATES COINCIDE WITH SPRING TIDES,THEN FLOODING IS A SERIOUS POSSIBILITY IN THIS AREA.OVER THE COURSE OF HISTORY MANY FLOODS HAVE BEEN RECORDED,THE MOST RECENT BEING THAT OF 13th DECEMBER 1981. ON THIS PARTICULAR OCCASION,THE TIDE HAD TURNED WHEN THE WIND CHANGED TO NORTH WEST AND INCREASED TO GALE FORCE EIGHT.SEA WATER BUILT UP AND FLOODED PARTS OF UPHILL TO A DEPTH OF THREE FEET. AS A RESULT OF THIS AND FLOODING ALONG THE WHOLE OF THE SOMERSET COAST LINE NORTH OF THE PARRETT ESTUARY, EXTENSIVE NEW SEA DEFENCES WERE PLANNED.THESE INCLUDE A MASSIVE CONCRETE WELL ACROSS THE PILL AND NEW EXTENSIVE EARTHEN WALLS.
